text: Relevant Information: strained stock Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Using a ladle, carefully skim off a few tablespoons of fat from the strained stock and add it to the Dutch oven (it's okay if a little stock gets in as well). Step: 4. Using a ladle, carefully skim off a few tablespoons of fat from the strained stock and add it to the Dutch oven (it's okay if a little stock gets in as well). Heat over high heat, swirling and stirring until the watery stock completely evaporates and starts to form a browned layer in the bottom of the pan. (It will spatter a bit. The more you stir, the less it will spatter.) As soon as the chicken fat starts to smoke, pour in the contents of the blender all at once and cook, stirring, for about 15 seconds (it will spatter a lot—wear an apron!). Immediately pour in strained chicken stock and fat and stir to combine. Bring to a bare simmer, stir in hominy, season to taste with salt, and keep warm.

query: what temperature do I have to set the oven to?

text: Relevant Information: fish Information Type: ingredient Instruction: You should be able to watch the heat penetrate the fish from each side because tuna changes color so dramatically, from a deep purple when raw to a beige when cooked. Step: 4. For an ideal doneness of rare, cook the fish long enough to sear each side, and no longer. You should be able to watch the heat penetrate the fish from each side because tuna changes color so dramatically, from a deep purple when raw to a beige when cooked. Use the side of the fish to gauge doneness: if you want it very rare in the center, the sides of the steaks should still look purple, with the color of the cooked fish just starting to creep in from above and below. If you want it a little more done, let the cooked color creep up a bit more from both sides. We don't recommend cooking tuna steaks beyond medium-rare.

text: Relevant Information: 6 to 8 ounces tuna Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Just before cooking, season tuna steaks all over with salt and, if desired, pepper. Step: 3. Cook tuna until first side is well-seared and the fish releases from the grill grate, 1 to 2 minutes. query: what do you combine the olive with?
text: Relevant Information: 1/4 cup olive Information Type: ingredient Instruction: In a large straight-sided sauté pan or skillet, combine olive oil, garlic, and anchovies (if using). Step: 1. In a large straight-sided sauté pan or skillet, combine olive oil, garlic, and anchovies (if using). Cook over medium-low heat, stirring and breaking up anchovies occasionally with a wooden spoon, until anchovies have dissolved and garlic has softened and is just beginning to turn lightly golden, about 5 minutes. Add red pepper flakes and continue to cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Increase heat to medium-high and add wine. Bring to a simmer and cook, swirling pan and scraping up any stuck-on bits with a wooden spoon, until wine has emulsified with olive oil and mixture is slightly reduced, about 30 seconds.

Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until bean mixture is thickened to a creamy, saucy consistency, 10 to 15 minutes.

query: How should I start preparing the carrots?
text: Relevant Information: 1 1/2 pounds Carrots Information Type: ingredient Instruction: For the Carrots: Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Step: 1. For the Carrots: Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated (If there's still lots of water left after the carrots are fully tender, drain.) Season cooked carrots with salt and pepper. Add thyme sprigs to pan, drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss to coat, and transfer to oven. Roast, turning occasionally, until carrots are lightly caramelized and wrinkled in appearance, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven, discard thyme, and set aside. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F.

query: How should I start preparing the carrots? Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. What technique is used to cook the carrots in the skillet?
text: Relevant Information: 1 1/2 pounds carrots Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Step: 1. For the Carrots: Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated (If there's still lots of water left after the carrots are fully tender, drain.) Season cooked carrots with salt and pepper. Add thyme sprigs to pan, drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss to coat, and transfer to oven. Roast, turning occasionally, until carrots are lightly caramelized and wrinkled in appearance, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven, discard thyme, and set aside. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F.

query: How should I start preparing the carrots? Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. What technique is used to cook the carrots in the skillet? Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated. what do I need to discard once I have removed the dish from the oven?
text: Relevant Information: 3 sprigs thyme Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Remove from oven, discard thyme, and set aside. Step: 1. For the Carrots: Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated (If there's still lots of water left after the carrots are fully tender, drain.) Season cooked carrots with salt and pepper. Add thyme sprigs to pan, drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss to coat, and transfer to oven. Roast, turning occasionally, until carrots are lightly caramelized and wrinkled in appearance, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven, discard thyme, and set aside. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F.

Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated. what do I need to discard once I have removed the dish from the oven? thyme what should I reduce the temperature to? to 350°f How do I prepare the mushrooms for the Duxelles? Place mushrooms in the work bowl of a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. what do I need to do with the oil? heat how long do the mushrooms need cooking for? about 12 minutes how long do I cook after I've added the garlic? about 1 minute What should I do after adding soy sauce and bourbon to the skillet? Cook until almost dry, about 2 minutes. Add breadcrumbs and stir to combine. Transfer mixture to a bowl. How do I prepare the bacon mushrooms before adding them to the bowl with duxelles? toss bacon mushrooms with maple syrup until thoroughly coated I need to add tarragon chives and what else? half of parsley, and chervil What is the process of making the mixture homogeneous? fold mixture together until homogenous. I need to add parsley tarragon chives and what else? chervil what should I season it with? salt I need to add salt and what else? pepper How should I chop the cashews? Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. What should I do with the beans after I have spread them on the baking sheet? Transfer to oven and roast, stirring occasionally, until beans are mostly split open and outer skins are beginning to get crunchy. how long must I roast them for? about 35 minutes What do I do with the beans after they are roasted? Transfer mixture to the work bowl of a food processor and set aside. what should I put the mixture into? work bowl what should I adjust the temperature on? oven What is the required cooking technique for the shiitake mushrooms? Cook, stirring frequently, until moisture evaporates and mushrooms are beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. how long should I cook it for? about 12 minutes Ok. what's next? Add leeks and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 4 minutes. what do I need to put it into? food processor work bowl what should I add as well as pepper? salt How can I prepare the dried beans and mushroom mixture for this recipe? Process dried beans and mushroom mixture until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. That's done. What's next? Transfer to bowl with cashews. what should I use to scrape down the sides? rubber spatula what should I transfer the seeds into? bowl What comes after moving the processed sunflower seeds and pumpkin seeds to the food processor? Pulse until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. I should add the palsy tarragon chives and what else? chervil What should I do after adding the remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil? Fold together. I'm not sure how to incorporate the herbs into the mixture. Could you guide me? <extra_id_0> Relevant Information: mixture Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Add remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil to mixture and fold together. Step: 8. Add remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil to mixture and fold together. Season generously with salt and pepper.
gold_answer: Add remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil to mixture and fold together.
target_answer: true Add remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil to mixture and fold together.
answer: Guide me to incorporate the herbs into the mixture.

query: How should I start preparing the carrots? Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. What technique is used to cook the carrots in the skillet? Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated. what do I need to discard once I have removed the dish from the oven? thyme what should I reduce the temperature to?
text: Relevant Information: oven Information Type: equipment Instruction: Reduce oven temperature to 350°F. Step: 1. For the Carrots: Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated (If there's still lots of water left after the carrots are fully tender, drain.) Season cooked carrots with salt and pepper. Add thyme sprigs to pan, drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil, toss to coat, and transfer to oven. Roast, turning occasionally, until carrots are lightly caramelized and wrinkled in appearance, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven, discard thyme, and set aside. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F.

Roast, turning occasionally, until carrots are lightly caramelized and wrinkled in appearance, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven, discard thyme, and set aside. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F.

Add leeks and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 4 minutes. what do I need to put it into? food processor work bowl what should I add as well as pepper? salt How can I prepare the dried beans and mushroom mixture for this recipe? Lay a single sheet of phyllo on a clean work surface and brush with olive oil. What should I use to avoid the phyllo sheets from drying out? Make sure to keep remaining phyllo covered with plastic wrap to avoid drying out. How should I prepare the phyllo and stuffing? Roll the phyllo and stuffing up like a burrito, tucking in the sides about half way through rolling. After rolling the filling in the phyllo, what should I do next? Set the cigar-shaped roll aside. query: How should I start preparing the carrots? Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. What technique is used to cook the carrots in the skillet? Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated. what do I need to discard once I have removed the dish from the oven? thyme what should I reduce the temperature to? to 350°f How do I prepare the mushrooms for the Duxelles? Place mushrooms in the work bowl of a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. what do I need to do with the oil? heat how long do the mushrooms need cooking for? about 12 minutes how long do I cook after I've added the garlic? about 1 minute What should I do after adding soy sauce and bourbon to the skillet? Cook until almost dry, about 2 minutes. Add breadcrumbs and stir to combine. Transfer mixture to a bowl. How do I prepare the bacon mushrooms before adding them to the bowl with duxelles? toss bacon mushrooms with maple syrup until thoroughly coated I need to add tarragon chives and what else? half of parsley, and chervil What is the process of making the mixture homogeneous? fold mixture together until homogenous. I need to add parsley tarragon chives and what else? chervil what should I season it with? salt I need to add salt and what else? pepper How should I chop the cashews? Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. What should I do with the beans after I have spread them on the baking sheet? Transfer to oven and roast, stirring occasionally, until beans are mostly split open and outer skins are beginning to get crunchy. how long must I roast them for? about 35 minutes What do I do with the beans after they are roasted? Transfer mixture to the work bowl of a food processor and set aside. what should I put the mixture into? work bowl what should I adjust the temperature on? oven What is the required cooking technique for the shiitake mushrooms? Cook, stirring frequently, until moisture evaporates and mushrooms are beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. how long should I cook it for? about 12 minutes Ok. what's next? Add leeks and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 4 minutes. what do I need to put it into? food processor work bowl what should I add as well as pepper? salt How can I prepare the dried beans and mushroom mixture for this recipe? Process dried beans and mushroom mixture until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. That's done. What's next? Transfer to bowl with cashews. what should I use to scrape down the sides? rubber spatula what should I transfer the seeds into? bowl What comes after moving the processed sunflower seeds and pumpkin seeds to the food processor? Pulse until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. I should add the palsy tarragon chives and what else? chervil What should I do after adding the remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil? Fold together. I'm not sure how to incorporate the herbs into the mixture. Could you guide me? Add remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil to mixture and fold together. I should season it with pepper and what? salt i should add half of what of the mixture? cup What should I do with the single sheet of phyllo? Lay a single sheet of phyllo on a clean work surface and brush with olive oil. What should I use to avoid the phyllo sheets from drying out? Make sure to keep remaining phyllo covered with plastic wrap to avoid drying out. How should I prepare the phyllo and stuffing? Roll the phyllo and stuffing up like a burrito, tucking in the sides about half way through rolling. After rolling the filling in the phyllo, what should I do next? Set the cigar-shaped roll aside. What should I do between laying each phyllo sheet? Brush each phyllo sheet with olive oil as you layer them. How do I properly stack phyllo sheets? Lay a clean sheet of phyllo on your work surface and brush with olive oil. Lay two more sheets on top, brushing each with olive oil as you layer them. spread half of the what? mushroom lay what in? roasted carrots How can I arrange the carrots on the phyllo sheet? Lay roasted carrots in even, parallel rows in the mushrooms What do I do with the phyllo sheet?
text: Relevant Information: roasted carrots Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Lay roasted carrots in even, parallel rows in the mushrooms and cover with remaining mushrooms, pressing down with clean hands to form an even layer. Step: 12. Spread half of mushroom duxelles evenly over bottom two thirds of phyllo sheet, leaving a 2-inch border all around. Lay roasted carrots in even, parallel rows in the mushrooms and cover with remaining mushrooms, pressing down with clean hands to form an even layer. Place the cigar-shaped phyllo roll on top of the carrots and mushrooms.

text: Relevant Information: mixture Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Line a rimmed baking sheet with a large piece of parchment paper and place remaining bean/cashew mixture on top of it in a rough 8-inch by 3-inch row. Step: 14. Line a rimmed baking sheet with a large piece of parchment paper and place remaining bean/cashew mixture on top of it in a rough 8-inch by 3-inch row. Lay a second sheet of parchment paper on top, followed by a second rimmed baking sheet. Press down firmly all over the baking sheet to spread mixture into a thin, even layer that will roughly fit on a piece of phyllo dough leaving a 2-inch border all around.

Transfer mixture to the work bowl of a food processor and set aside. what should I put the mixture into? work bowl what should I adjust the temperature on? oven What is the required cooking technique for the shiitake mushrooms? Cook, stirring frequently, until moisture evaporates and mushrooms are beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. how long should I cook it for? about 12 minutes Ok. what's next? Process dried beans and mushroom mixture until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. That's done. What's next? Lay a single sheet of phyllo on a clean work surface and brush with olive oil. What should I use to avoid the phyllo sheets from drying out? Make sure to keep remaining phyllo covered with plastic wrap to avoid drying out. How should I prepare the phyllo and stuffing? Roll the phyllo and stuffing up like a burrito, tucking in the sides about half way through rolling. After rolling the filling in the phyllo, what should I do next? Set the cigar-shaped roll aside. text: Relevant Information: mixture Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Press down firmly all over the baking sheet to spread mixture into a thin, even layer that will roughly fit on a piece of phyllo dough leaving a 2-inch border all around. text: Relevant Information: work bowl Information Type: equipment Instruction: For the Duxelles: Place mushrooms in the work bowl of a food processor. Step: 2. For the Duxelles: Place mushrooms in the work bowl of a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over high heat until shimmering. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until moisture has evaporated and mushrooms begin to brown, about 12 minutes. Add breadcrumbs and stir to combine. Transfer mixture to a bowl.

Place mushrooms in the work bowl of a food processor. Cook until almost dry, about 2 minutes. Add breadcrumbs and stir to combine. Transfer mixture to a bowl. How do I prepare the bacon mushrooms before adding them to the bowl with duxelles? toss bacon mushrooms with maple syrup until thoroughly coated I need to add tarragon chives and what else? half of parsley, and chervil What is the process of making the mixture homogeneous? fold mixture together until homogenous. I need to add parsley tarragon chives and what else? chervil what should I season it with? salt I need to add salt and what else? pepper How should I chop the cashews? Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. What should I do with the beans after I have spread them on the baking sheet? Transfer to oven and roast, stirring occasionally, until beans are mostly split open and outer skins are beginning to get crunchy. how long must I roast them for? about 35 minutes What do I do with the beans after they are roasted? Transfer mixture to the work bowl of a food processor and set aside. what should I put the mixture into? work bowl what should I adjust the temperature on? oven What is the required cooking technique for the shiitake mushrooms? Cook, stirring frequently, until moisture evaporates and mushrooms are beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. how long should I cook it for? about 12 minutes Ok. what's next? Add leeks and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 4 minutes. what do I need to put it into? food processor work bowl what should I add as well as pepper? salt How can I prepare the dried beans and mushroom mixture for this recipe? I should add the palsy tarragon chives and what else? chervil What should I do after adding the remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil? Fold together. Roll the phyllo and stuffing up like a burrito, tucking in the sides about half way through rolling. After rolling the filling in the phyllo, what should I do next? Set the cigar-shaped roll aside. query: How should I start preparing the carrots? Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. What technique is used to cook the carrots in the skillet? Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated. what do I need to discard once I have removed the dish from the oven? thyme what should I reduce the temperature to? to 350°f How do I prepare the mushrooms for the Duxelles? Place mushrooms in the work bowl of a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. what do I need to do with the oil? heat how long do the mushrooms need cooking for? about 12 minutes how long do I cook after I've added the garlic? about 1 minute What should I do after adding soy sauce and bourbon to the skillet? Cook until almost dry, about 2 minutes. Add breadcrumbs and stir to combine. Transfer mixture to a bowl. How do I prepare the bacon mushrooms before adding them to the bowl with duxelles? toss bacon mushrooms with maple syrup until thoroughly coated I need to add tarragon chives and what else? half of parsley, and chervil What is the process of making the mixture homogeneous? fold mixture together until homogenous. I need to add parsley tarragon chives and what else? chervil what should I season it with? salt I need to add salt and what else? pepper How should I chop the cashews? Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. What should I do with the beans after I have spread them on the baking sheet? Transfer to oven and roast, stirring occasionally, until beans are mostly split open and outer skins are beginning to get crunchy. how long must I roast them for? about 35 minutes What do I do with the beans after they are roasted? Transfer mixture to the work bowl of a food processor and set aside. what should I put the mixture into? work bowl what should I adjust the temperature on? oven What is the required cooking technique for the shiitake mushrooms? Cook, stirring frequently, until moisture evaporates and mushrooms are beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. how long should I cook it for? about 12 minutes Ok. what's next? Add leeks and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 4 minutes. what do I need to put it into? food processor work bowl what should I add as well as pepper? salt How can I prepare the dried beans and mushroom mixture for this recipe? Process dried beans and mushroom mixture until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. That's done. What's next? Transfer to bowl with cashews. what should I use to scrape down the sides? rubber spatula what should I transfer the seeds into? bowl What comes after moving the processed sunflower seeds and pumpkin seeds to the food processor? Pulse until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. I should add the palsy tarragon chives and what else? chervil What should I do after adding the remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil? Fold together. I'm not sure how to incorporate the herbs into the mixture. Could you guide me? Add remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil to mixture and fold together. I should season it with pepper and what? salt i should add half of what of the mixture? cup What should I do with the single sheet of phyllo? Lay a single sheet of phyllo on a clean work surface and brush with olive oil. What should I use to avoid the phyllo sheets from drying out? Make sure to keep remaining phyllo covered with plastic wrap to avoid drying out. How should I prepare the phyllo and stuffing? Roll the phyllo and stuffing up like a burrito, tucking in the sides about half way through rolling. After rolling the filling in the phyllo, what should I do next? Set the cigar-shaped roll aside. What should I do between laying each phyllo sheet? Brush each phyllo sheet with olive oil as you layer them. How do I properly stack phyllo sheets? Lay a clean sheet of phyllo on your work surface and brush with olive oil. Lay two more sheets on top, brushing each with olive oil as you layer them. spread half of the what? mushroom lay what in? roasted carrots How can I arrange the carrots on the phyllo sheet? Lay roasted carrots in even, parallel rows in the mushrooms What do I do with the phyllo sheet? Roll the phyllo sheet up into a tight cylinder and set aside. How can I ensure even distribution of the bean/cashew mixture on the baking sheet? Press down firmly all over the baking sheet to spread mixture into a thin, even layer. I need to roughly fit it on a piece of phyllo what? dough what should I spread into a thin even layer? mixture How do I proceed after taking off the top layer of parchment paper? Place a single layer of phyllo dough on top. What should I do after brushing the phyllo with olive oil? add another sheet of phyllo, and repeat, adding a total of 5 to 6 layers of phyllo and oil What does it mean if my bean/cashew layer is not thin and even? <no_answer> How do I secure the roll with the phyllo sheet? Place the existing carrot/mushroom roll on top and roll up to secure. I need to place the existing carrot and what? mushroom How should I prepare the phyllo sheet before adding the roll on top? text: Relevant Information: 1 quart stock Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Whisking constantly, slowly drizzle in stock. Step: 20. For the Gravy: While roast is baking, make the gravy. Combine 3 tablespoons olive oil and flour in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat and cook, stirring constantly with a whisk until flour is nutty brown, about 3 minutes. Whisking constantly, slowly drizzle in stock. Add soy sauce, thyme sprigs, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook until thickened and reduced to 3 cups, about 20 minutes. Season to taste with salt and lots of black pepper.

Cook until almost dry, about 2 minutes. Add breadcrumbs and stir to combine. Transfer mixture to a bowl. How do I prepare the bacon mushrooms before adding them to the bowl with duxelles? toss bacon mushrooms with maple syrup until thoroughly coated I need to add tarragon chives and what else? half of parsley, and chervil What is the process of making the mixture homogeneous? fold mixture together until homogenous. I need to add parsley tarragon chives and what else? chervil what should I season it with? salt I need to add salt and what else? pepper How should I chop the cashews? Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. What should I do with the beans after I have spread them on the baking sheet? Transfer mixture to the work bowl of a food processor and set aside. what should I put the mixture into? work bowl what should I adjust the temperature on? oven What is the required cooking technique for the shiitake mushrooms? Cook, stirring frequently, until moisture evaporates and mushrooms are beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. how long should I cook it for? about 12 minutes Ok. what's next? Add leeks and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 4 minutes. what do I need to put it into? food processor work bowl what should I add as well as pepper? salt How can I prepare the dried beans and mushroom mixture for this recipe? Process dried beans and mushroom mixture until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. That's done. What's next? Transfer to bowl with cashews. what should I use to scrape down the sides? rubber spatula what should I transfer the seeds into? bowl What comes after moving the processed sunflower seeds and pumpkin seeds to the food processor? Pulse until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. I should add the palsy tarragon chives and what else? chervil What should I do after adding the remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil? Fold together. I'm not sure how to incorporate the herbs into the mixture. Could you guide me? Add remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil to mixture and fold together. Lay a single sheet of phyllo on a clean work surface and brush with olive oil. What should I use to avoid the phyllo sheets from drying out? Make sure to keep remaining phyllo covered with plastic wrap to avoid drying out. How should I prepare the phyllo and stuffing? Roll the phyllo and stuffing up like a burrito, tucking in the sides about half way through rolling. After rolling the filling in the phyllo, what should I do next? Set the cigar-shaped roll aside. What should I do between laying each phyllo sheet? Brush each phyllo sheet with olive oil as you layer them. How do I properly stack phyllo sheets? Place the existing carrot/mushroom roll on top and roll up to secure. I need to place the existing carrot and what? mushroom How should I prepare the phyllo sheet before adding the roll on top? What are the steps to make the gravy? <extra_id_0> Relevant Information: 1 quart stock Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Whisking constantly, slowly drizzle in stock. Step: 20. For the Gravy: While roast is baking, make the gravy. Combine 3 tablespoons olive oil and flour in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat and cook, stirring constantly with a whisk until flour is nutty brown, about 3 minutes. Whisking constantly, slowly drizzle in stock. Add soy sauce, thyme sprigs, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook until thickened and reduced to 3 cups, about 20 minutes. Season to taste with salt and lots of black pepper.

query: How should I start preparing the carrots? Adjust oven rack center position and preheat oven to 400°F. Place carrots in a large skillet and cover with cold water. Season gently with salt. What technique is used to cook the carrots in the skillet? Bring to a boil and cook until carrots are tender and water has mostly evaporated. what do I need to discard once I have removed the dish from the oven? thyme what should I reduce the temperature to? to 350°f How do I prepare the mushrooms for the Duxelles? Place mushrooms in the work bowl of a food processor. Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. what do I need to do with the oil? heat how long do the mushrooms need cooking for? about 12 minutes how long do I cook after I've added the garlic? about 1 minute What should I do after adding soy sauce and bourbon to the skillet? Cook until almost dry, about 2 minutes. Add breadcrumbs and stir to combine. Transfer mixture to a bowl. How do I prepare the bacon mushrooms before adding them to the bowl with duxelles? toss bacon mushrooms with maple syrup until thoroughly coated I need to add tarragon chives and what else? half of parsley, and chervil What is the process of making the mixture homogeneous? fold mixture together until homogenous. I need to add parsley tarragon chives and what else? chervil what should I season it with? salt I need to add salt and what else? pepper How should I chop the cashews? Pulse until finely chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. What should I do with the beans after I have spread them on the baking sheet? Transfer to oven and roast, stirring occasionally, until beans are mostly split open and outer skins are beginning to get crunchy. how long must I roast them for? about 35 minutes What do I do with the beans after they are roasted? Transfer mixture to the work bowl of a food processor and set aside. what should I put the mixture into? work bowl what should I adjust the temperature on? oven What is the required cooking technique for the shiitake mushrooms? Cook, stirring frequently, until moisture evaporates and mushrooms are beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. how long should I cook it for? about 12 minutes Ok. what's next? Add leeks and celery and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 4 minutes. what do I need to put it into? food processor work bowl what should I add as well as pepper? salt How can I prepare the dried beans and mushroom mixture for this recipe? Process dried beans and mushroom mixture until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. That's done. What's next? Transfer to bowl with cashews. what should I use to scrape down the sides? rubber spatula what should I transfer the seeds into? bowl What comes after moving the processed sunflower seeds and pumpkin seeds to the food processor? Pulse until roughly chopped, scraping down sides with a rubber spatula as necessary, 8 to 10 short pulses. I should add the palsy tarragon chives and what else? chervil What should I do after adding the remaining parsley, tarragon, chives, and chervil? Fold together. Add tomatoes and their juices plus 1 cup (240ml) water and, using the back of wooden spoon, crush tomatoes.

query: what sort of oil should be used for the pasta?
text: Relevant Information: 1/4 cup olive Information Type: ingredient Instruction: In a large straight-sided sauté pan or skillet, combine olive oil, garlic, and anchovies (if using). Step: 1. In a large straight-sided sauté pan or skillet, combine olive oil, garlic, and anchovies (if using). Cook over medium-low heat, stirring and breaking up anchovies occasionally with a wooden spoon, until anchovies have dissolved and garlic has softened and is just beginning to turn lightly golden, about 5 minutes. Add red pepper flakes and continue to cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Increase heat to medium-high and add wine. Bring to a simmer and cook, swirling pan and scraping up any stuck-on bits with a wooden spoon, until wine has emulsified with olive oil and mixture is slightly reduced, about 30 seconds.

Toss with marinade until evenly coated. what size bowl should I use? medium mixing bowl Ok done! text: Relevant Information: heat Information Type: temperature Instruction: In a Dutch oven, heat canola oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Step: 6. In a Dutch oven, heat canola oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add onions and baking soda and, using a wooden spoon, stir to coat onions in oil and distribute baking soda. text: Relevant Information: Dutch oven Information Type: equipment Instruction: In a Dutch oven, heat canola oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Step: 6. In a Dutch oven, heat canola oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add onions and baking soda and, using a wooden spoon, stir to coat onions in oil and distribute baking soda. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onions have completely broken down, most of their moisture has cooked off, and they begin to brown, 14 to 17 minutes. If at any point onions seem to be browning too quickly or unevenly, add a tablespoon (15ml) of water and scrape up any brown bits that form on the bottom of the pot.

Purée tomatoes in the can using an immersion blender or transfer to the bowl of a countertop blender and purée until smooth. what type of oil is used? olive how long do I need to cook the meat for? about 10 minutes what other herbs am I using? sage, and half of parsley What to do if my vegetables are browning too quickly? <no_answer> What is the next step after heating butter and pancetta in the skillet? Add onion, carrots, celery, garlic, sage, and half of parsley and cook, stirring and tossing, until vegetables are completely softened but not browned, about 8 minutes. what heat should it be on? high heat How can I ensure that the liquid in the pan has evaporated properly? Cook, stirring, until most of the liquid has evaporated from the pan. how long should I leave it on the heat? about 10 minutes What should I do after adding the wine? Cook, stirring, until mostly evaporated. after the reserved stock and tomatoes what ingredients am I adding? milk, and bay leaves after the reserved stock what ingredients am I adding? tomatoes, milk, and bay leaves after the wine what ingredients am I adding? reserved stock, tomatoes, milk, and bay leaves How should I season the mixture? query: What should I do with the turkey skin after removing it?
text: Relevant Information: 5 pounds turkey Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Carefully remove turkey skin in a single piece and set aside. Step: 1. Carefully remove turkey skin in a single piece and set aside. Using a sharp boning knife, remove breast meat from breastbone. Set breastbone aside. Season turkey generously with salt and pepper on all sides. Place 1 breast half, cut side facing up, on a work surface. Place second breast half facedown, so the fat end aligns with the skinny end of the first breast half. Gently form into an even cylinder.

How long can the tied turkey be stored before cooking? up to 5 days how long can I keep the turkey in the fridge before the next step? 5 days What temperature should the sous vide water bath be heated to? 145°F (63°C) what temperature should the water bath be in Fahrenheit? to 145°f how many degrees Celsius do I set the water bath to? 63°c How is the turkey lowered into the water bath? With bag open, slowly lower bagged turkey into water, letting water pressure squeeze air out of bag until just the seal remains above the waterline. Seal bag completely. How long should the turkey be cooked? for 2 1/2 hours how many degrees Celsius do I set the oven to? 200°c what is it that I preheat? oven How should I prepare the skin for cooking?
text: Relevant Information: oven Information Type: equipment Instruction: For the Crispy Skin: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Step: 4. For the Crispy Skin: Adjust oven rack to center position and preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Spread skin evenly over a piece of parchment paper set in a rimmed baking sheet. Season generously with salt and pepper. Place a second sheet of parchment on top and carefully squeeze out any air bubbles using the side of your hand. Place a second rimmed baking sheet on top and transfer to oven.

How do I prepare the gravy with the breastbone?
text: Relevant Information: 1 teaspoon soy Information Type: ingredient Instruction: Add stock, bay leaves, and soy sauce. Step: 6. For the Gravy: Using a cleaver, chop breastbone into 1-inch chunks. In a medium saucepan over high heat, heat oil until smoking. Add breastbone, onion, carrot, and celery and cook, stirring occasionally, until well browned, about 10 minutes total. Add stock, bay leaves, and soy sauce. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Simmer for 1 hour, then strain through a fine-mesh strainer. You should have a little over 1 quart (900ml) of fortified stock; if not, add water or more chicken stock to equal 1 quart. Discard solids and set stock aside.

query: What should I do with the turkey skin after removing it? set aside what do I use to remove the breast meat from the breast bone?
text: Relevant Information: sharp boning knife Information Type: equipment Instruction: Using a sharp boning knife, remove breast meat from breastbone. Step: 1. Carefully remove turkey skin in a single piece and set aside. Using a sharp boning knife, remove breast meat from breastbone. Set breastbone aside. Season turkey generously with salt and pepper on all sides. Place 1 breast half, cut side facing up, on a work surface. Place second breast half facedown, so the fat end aligns with the skinny end of the first breast half. Gently form into an even cylinder.
